intro: Junellia seriphioides, commonly known as the slender false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. It has slender, erect stems and palmately lobed leaves, and its flowers bloom in summer. Junellia seriphioides is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
